articleContent.title: Arpeggio: Minor Major 7th in G# (Shape: A)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: Minor Major 7th in G# (Shape: A)

## Introduction
An arpeggio is a musical technique where the notes of a chord are played in sequence, rather than all together. The Minor Major 7th arpeggio in G# (also known as G#mMaj7) consists of the notes G#, B, D#, and F##. This arpeggio has a unique and sophisticated sound due to the augmented 5th interval between the third and fourth notes.

## Notes and Intervals
- G# (Root)
- B (Minor 3rd)
- D# (Perfect 5th)
- F## (Major 7th or Leading Tone)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Minor Major 7th arpeggio is often used in jazz, fusion, and other sophisticated styles of music. It adds a sense of tension and intrigue to compositions, blending the melancholy of the minor tonality with the dissonance of the augmented interval.

## Songs
Here are three songs that use the Minor Major 7th arpeggio in G# (Shape: A):
1. "Impressions" by John Coltrane
2. "Spain" by Chick Corea
3. "So What" by Miles Davis
